page.title: 11CODMORE HILL GARDEN CENTRE
page.content: On the western side of the A29,a former nursery is being converted into a garden centre to be called "Nightingales". Plants for sale will be displayed on islands and watered by a piped irrigation system automatically programmed to come into operation when the centre is closed to the public. A former greenhouse is being converted into a shop and restaurant, with an aquarium in one corner. The new owners, whose main centre is at Horsham,intend to take over the full 12 acres of nursery and restore the derelict or run down greenhouses. They will propagate and grow for sale, plants which are now regarded as unusual. The business will provide employment for about 15 full time staff and some part time helpers.
